level.heading: Final written expression: parol or extrinsic evidence.
level.text: Terms with respect to which the confirmatory memoranda of the parties agree or which are otherwise set forth in a writing intended by the parties as a final expression of their agreement with respect to such terms as are included therein may not be contradicted by evidence of any prior agreement or of a contemporaneous oral agreement but may be explained or supplemented:
by course of performance, course of dealing, or usage of trade (§ 28:1-303); and
by evidence of consistent additional terms unless the court finds the writing to have been intended also as a complete and exclusive statement of the terms of the agreement.

level.heading: Section References
level.text: This section is referenced in § 28:2-316 and § 28:2-326.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-299 rewrote (a).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 19-299
level.text: Law 19-299, the "Uniform Commercial Code Revision Act of 2012," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 19-136. The Bill was adopted on first reading on Dec. 4, 2012. Signed by the Mayor on Feb. 8, 2013, it was assigned Act No. 19-667 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 19-299 became effective on Apr. 27, 2013.
